fields.name: projectMission-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Brief project summary
fields.helper_text: Highlight your project's approach, unique value proposition, and its climate impacts to prospective buyers and investors in 1-2 sentences

fields.name: domain-grapheneProject-iwa
fields.label: Project website
fields.tooltip: Link to the project website

fields.name: kd1Media-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Key differentiator image or video
fields.helper_text: Upload an image or a video to complement this first differentiator

fields.name: kd2Media-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Key differentiator image or video
fields.helper_text: Upload an image or a video to complement this second differentator

fields.name: kd3Media-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Key differentiator image or video
fields.helper_text: Upload an image or a video to complement this third differentator

fields.name: projectStatus-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project status
fields.tooltip: Indicates the current stage of the project's development: (A) Under development: the project is in the early stages and has not yet completed validation; (B) Validated: The project has been reviewed and approved against the relevant methodology and standards but is not yet generating verified credits; (C) Verified: The project has undergone verification and is actively generating verified credits.

fields.name: totalForecast-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Credit period forecast
fields.tooltip: The total estimated issued credits over the crediting period (i.e., tonnes of CO2e removed, avoided, or reduced)
fields.helper_text: Indicate the total estimated delivery of credits over the crediting period (i.e., tonnes of CO2e removed, avoided, or reduced)

fields.name: acreage-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Total acreage
fields.tooltip: The total acreage of forestland within the physical project boundaries
fields.helper_text: Indicate the total acreage in acres or hectares

fields.name: methodology-modularBenefitProject-iwa
fields.label: Methodology
options: VM0045 Methodology for Improved Forest Management v1.0
VM0045 Methodology for Improved Forest Management v1.1
ACR Improved Forest Management (IFM) on Non-Federal U.S. Forestlands v2.0
Puro Standard Biochar Methodology Edition 2022 v3
fields.tooltip: Methodology or protocol used for credit generation

fields.name: organizationHeadquarters-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Headquarters city and state
fields.tooltip: Where the main office of the organization is located
fields.helper_text: Indicate the city and state of the organization's headquarters in the format of [city], [state initials]

fields.name: organizationOperationYears-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Years developing carbon projects
fields.tooltip: The number of years the organization has been actively operating projects within this specific pathway or mitigation activity

fields.name: projectSummary-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: General project description
fields.helper_text: Briefly describe the measures implemented, project location, scenario before the project, project impact on GHG removals or reductions, estimated annual average removals or reductions, and any ecological or socioeconomic impact

fields.name: projectMedia-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Project photos or videos
fields.helper_text: Upload high-quality photos or videos for this project's listing page; you can include the display image here as well

fields.name: projectActivities-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Description of activities
fields.helper_text: Describe the mitigation activities that take place as a part of the project

fields.name: links-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Media links
fields.tooltip: Collection of relevant media links (e.g. articles, blog posts)

fields.name: projectTimeline-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Additional details on project timeline
fields.tooltip: Relevant additional information regarding the project's timeline
fields.helper_text: Optional field to add additional information regarding the project's timeline

fields.name: termLength-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project term commitment (in years)
fields.tooltip: Projects must commit to a minimum project term of 40 years

fields.name: creditStart-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Crediting start year
fields.tooltip: The start of the crediting period, in which verified GHG emission reductions or removals from to a project activity can result in the issuance of carbon credits (i.e., the year that the project begins issuing credits)

fields.name: creditEnd-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Crediting end year
fields.tooltip: The end of the crediting period, in which verified GHG emission reductions or removals from to a project activity can result in the issuance of carbon credits (i.e., the year that the project stops issuing credits)

fields.name: projectScale-modularBenefitProject-iwa
fields.label: Project scale
fields.tooltip: An indication of the estimated tonnes of CO2e to be sequestered or avoided over the life of the project

fields.name: projectType-modularBenefitProject-iwa
fields.label: Project type
options: Avoided Conversion of Grasslands and Shrublands (ACoGS)
Bioenergy with Carbon Capture and Storage (BECCS)
Methane Gas Leak Detection and Repair
Reduced Emissions from Deforestation and Degradation (REDD)
fields.tooltip: Emission reduction or sequestration pathway of project (eg. IFM, REDD++, Biochar, DAC etc.)

fields.name: classificationCategory-modularBenefitProject-iwa
fields.label: Classification category
fields.tooltip: Ecological benefit category for the project

fields.name: classificationMethod-modularBenefitProject-iwa
fields.label: Classification method
options: Natural - The activity claim uses natural methods (e.g. IFM)
Technological - The activity claim uses technology (e.g. DAC)
Both: Natural and Technological - The activity claim uses both natural and technology methods (e.g. BECCS)
fields.tooltip: Category of the mitigation activity

fields.name: approachComments-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Additional comments on project approach
fields.tooltip: If relevant, any additional or missing information about the project's fundamental approach
fields.helper_text: Use this space to include any missing or additional information about the fundamental project approach

fields.name: pdd-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Project plan document
fields.tooltip: If relevant, the project plan document (e.g., GHG plan, PDD)

fields.name: creditIssuer-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Credit issuer
fields.tooltip: The body responsible for issuing the credits

fields.name: standardVersion-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Registry standard version used
fields.tooltip: Carbon crediting programs (e.g., Verra, ACR, CAR, Puro Earth) publish general rules and documentation that projects must adhere to in addition to a given methodology. These programs or standards are updated periodically (e.g., ACR Standard Version 8.0, Puro General Rules Version 4.0, etc.)
fields.helper_text: Indicate which version of the carbon crediting program's standard the project was developed against (e.g., VCS Version 4.0, Puro General Rules 4.0)

fields.name: projectRegistryLink-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project registry link
fields.tooltip: If relevant, the link to the project's registry listing page
fields.helper_text: If relevant, provide the project's listing page on its given registry

fields.name: projectRegistryID-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project registry ID
fields.tooltip: If relevant, the project's unique ID in the project's respective registry

fields.name: countries-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Country or countries of project activity
fields.tooltip: Country or countries where the project activities take place

fields.name: conflictAreas-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project takes place in conflict-affected or disputed areas
fields.tooltip: Conflict-affected areas as defined by the World Bank here: https://thedocs.worldbank.org/en/doc/b3c737c4687db176ec98f5c434d0de91-0090082024/original/FCSListFY25.pdf

fields.name: conflictMoreInfo-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Additional information about the conflict-affected area(s)
fields.tooltip: Additional context on the conflict-affected area(s) and the additional measures taken to implement the project
fields.helper_text: Provide additional context on the conflict-affected area and the additional measures considered when implementing the project

fields.name: geographicLocation-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Project boundary file
fields.tooltip: Project boundary files for project locations indicated

fields.name: locationComments-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Location details
fields.tooltip: Additional comments and context on project location including relevant coordinates where project activities take place

fields.name: projectLocationACR-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project location type
fields.tooltip: Indicates if the project is singular or part of a project programme (i.e., collection of multiple proponents under one project)

fields.name: projectGroupInfo-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Grouped project information
fields.tooltip: Additional information relevant to the design of the grouped project

sections.name: laborRights
sections.label: Labor rights and protection of workers

fields.name: laborChildren-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project will not employ persons under the age of 15

fields.name: laborChildDevelopment-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project complies with age-related legal frameworks
fields.tooltip: Indicates compliance with the ILO Convention 138 Minimum Age Convention 1973 and/or national labor laws related to minimum age

fields.name: laborWorkersRights-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project intends to protect and uphold the rights of workers
fields.tooltip: The rights of workers as defined by the ILO Declaration of Fundamental Principles and Rights at Work

fields.name: laborUpload-projectFile-storage
fields.label: International standards-compliant code of conduct or other labor rights documentation

fields.name: laborComments-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Additional comments on labor rights and protection of workers
fields.helper_text: Use this space to clarify any information regarding labor practices

fields.name: nationalLawsCompliance-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Compliance with all applicable national laws
fields.tooltip: Attestation of compliance with the applicable national laws of the project country

fields.name: communityFrameworks-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Measures taken to comply with frameworks governing the rights of Indigenous, tribal, and local communities
fields.tooltip: If relevant, description of the measures taken to adhere to national or international frameworks supporting the rights of Indigenous, tribal and local communities (including the UN Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples)
fields.helper_text: Describe any relevant national frameworks and corresponding compliance supporting the rights of Indigenous, tribal and local communities

fields.name: nationalLawsUpload-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Legal compliance documentation
fields.tooltip: Evidence that supports the claims above (e.g., background checks conducted, etc.)

fields.name: parisCompliance-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: The country where this project occurs is a party to the Paris Agreement

fields.name: parisLetter-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Evidence of project's inclusion in the Nationally Determined Contribution (NDC) and/or Paris Agreement
fields.tooltip: Link to the letter of approval for the corresponding adjustment if needed

fields.name: carbonAuthorization-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project is authorized for carbon use
options: Yes, I have a government concession
Yes, I have authorization from the owner (private)
fields.tooltip: Authorization of carbon use indicates that the project activity is legally allowed to be executed

fields.name: carbonConservationContract-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Concession contract is at least the same length as the crediting period
fields.tooltip: Relevant for public land projects

display_dependencies.pattern: Yes, I have a government concession

fields.name: timber-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Land ownership class
fields.tooltip: The timber ownership class determines the annual discount rate applied
fields.helper_text: Select the current timber ownership class

fields.name: carbonUpload-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Land or facility ownership documentation
fields.helper_text: Provide documentation such as land or facility ownership and rights attestation, clear land title, resource ownership, and/or project contracts

fields.name: carbonIssuing-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project is receiving or seeking credit for reductions and removals under another GHG program

fields.name: carbonRegistration-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project has registered under other GHG programs

fields.name: carbonRegistrationYes-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Registration number and date of project inactivity under other GHG program

fields.name: carbonRejection-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project has been rejected by another GHG program

fields.name: carbonRejectionYes-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Program name(s), reason(s) and date of rejection

fields.name: ownershipStructure-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Ownership structure
fields.tooltip: Major shareholders and/or owners of the organization

fields.name: governanceStructure-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Governance structure
fields.tooltip: How the organization is governed; all stakeholders involved and systems that guide the organization's decision-making and operations
fields.helper_text: Include the team structure and each organization involved including their responsibilities

fields.name: organizationStructureUpload-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Ownership and governance structure documentation
fields.helper_text: Upload schematics or documentation to demonstrate your organization's ownership structure and governance structure

fields.name: organizationIncorporation-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Incorporation city and state
fields.tooltip: Where the organization is incorporated
fields.helper_text: Indicate the city and state where the organization is incorporated in the format: [city], [state initials]

fields.name: projectEmployees-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Number of employees staffed on project
fields.tooltip: Full-time and part-time employees and contractors who directly work on the project

fields.name: projectLandowners-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Number of landowners
fields.tooltip: Landowners within project activity, such as farmers

fields.name: orgMission-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Organization mission
fields.helper_text: Summarize your organizations purpose, values, and goals related to climate action

fields.name: organizationExperiencePathway-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Number of projects within pathway
fields.tooltip: The number of projects developed by the organization within the specific pathway
fields.helper_text: Indicate the number of projects developed by the organization within the specific pathway

fields.name: organizationExperienceDetails-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Organization history and experience details
fields.helper_text: Describe an overview of the team leads' experience and technical expertise, the details and results of projects the organization has developed (if applicable), and any other significant historical aspects of the Project Proponent organization

fields.name: forecastActualsChart-dataGrid-dataGrid
fields.label: Forecast vs actuals: Net credits in tCO2e

fields.name: forecastConditional-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project forecasts emission reductions and/or removals
fields.tooltip: Forecasting carbon removals or reductions is the process of estimating the amount of greenhouse gases that a project is expected to remove from or prevent from entering the atmosphere over a future period, based on scientific models, historical data, and project-specific assumptions

fields.name: forecastTable-dataGrid-dataGrid
fields.label: Forecasted emissions reductions and removals per vintage (tCO2e)

options.name: estimatedGrossReductionsRemovals
options.label: Estimated emissions reductions and removals (pre-buffer deduction)

fields.tooltip: The estimated emissions reductions and removals per vintage (including pre- and post-buffer deduction). Net removals and reductions refer to the total removals and reductions post-buffer deductions.

fields.name: forecastComments-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Additional comments on forecast
fields.tooltip: Optional additional context on the credit forecast

fields.name: forecastWorkbook-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Forecast supporting documents
fields.tooltip: Documentation may include registry-specific forecast templates (such as the ACR ERT calculator) and other templates or documents that support the calculations
fields.helper_text: Upload supporting documentation regarding the carbon credit forecast

fields.name: projectActuals-dataGrid-dataGrid
fields.label: Actual emissions reductions and removals per vintage (tCO2e)

options.name: actualGrossRemovalsReductions
options.label: Actual emissions reductions and removals (pre-buffer deduction)

fields.tooltip: The actual emissions reductions and removals per vintage (including pre- and post-buffer deduction)
fields.helper_text: Input actual emissions reductions, removals, and credit issuance in tCO2e data in the data grid

fields.name: projectActualsACR-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Project actuals supporting documents
fields.helper_text: Upload actual ERT calculation documents (e.g., registry-specific workbooks or templates)

fields.name: estimatedPriceMin-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Estimated minimum price (USD)
fields.tooltip: Project proponent-generated estimated minimum price to sell one credit of tCO2e

fields.name: estimatedPriceMax-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Estimated maximum price (USD)
fields.tooltip: Project proponent-generated estimated maximum price to sell one credit of tCO2e

fields.name: creditSalesStage-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Credit sales type
fields.tooltip:
Spot: A sale where carbon credits are exchanged and delivered immediately at the current market price.
Offtake Agreement: A long-term contract where a buyer agrees to purchase a specific volume of carbon credits over time, often before they are issued.
Forward: A contract where carbon credits are sold at an agreed-upon price for delivery at a future date.
Other: Any other type of carbon credit sale that doesnt fit the standard definitions, such as custom agreements or hybrid structures.

fields.name: carbonCreditBuyer-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Carbon credit buyers
fields.tooltip: Buyers who have purchased carbon credits from this project

field_groups.name: landOwnershipComplianceView
field_groups.label: Land ownership and legal harvesting compliance

fields.name: ownershipSummaryDocumentation-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Timber rights ownership documentation
fields.tooltip: Supporting documents related to timber rights ownership or control

fields.name: commercialHarvesting-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Commercial harvesting at project start date

fields.name: nonCommercial-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Later occurrence of commercial harvesting
fields.tooltip: Later occurance of commercial harvesting indicates that the project area is not undergoing commerical harvest at the project start date, but will be subject to harvesting later in the project life cycle
fields.helper_text: If "Yes" then the project proponent must meet the requirements outlined above

fields.name: commercial-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Commercial harvesting requirements
options: Be certified by FSC, SFI, or ATFS or become certified within one year of the project start date
Be enrolled in a state sanctioned forestry program with monitoring and enforcement mechanism in place
For private landowners owning less than 2,500 forested acres
Provide a documented long-term forest management plan
Demonstrating sustainable forest management prepared and signed by a professional forester
Federally recognized tribes must demonstrate a current BIA approved forest management plan
fields.tooltip: Project areas subject to commercial harvesting at the project start date in the with-project scenario must adhere to one or a combination of the following options. Non-federally recognized tribal lands may utilize one or more of the sustainable mangement demonstrations above or, in the absence of such verifiable evidence, may adhere to sustainable forest management practices informed by traditional knowledge. Where possible, practices informed by traditional knowledge should be evidenced by a document such as a traditional land use plan, but it is recognized that principles of traditional alnd use are often not documented and exist in oral communication.

fields.name: forestManagement-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Sustainable management plan documentation
fields.tooltip: Private landowners owning less than 2,500 forested acres may fulfill the sustainable management requirement by providing a documented long-term forest management plan prepared and signed by a professional forester. Projects must identify how their plan is compatible with Criteria 1 through 6 of the Montral Process Criteria and Indicators. Criterion 5 (Maintenance of forest contribution to global carbon cycles) is satisfied by enrollment in the carbon project. Criterion 7 (Legal, institutional, and economic framework for forest conservation and sustainable management) is not relevant at the project scale and therefore not considered.
fields.helper_text: Provide details on certification, state sanctioned forestry program and enforcement mechanisms, or forestry management plan

fields.name: updateProcedure-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Inventory development overview
fields.tooltip: Description of the inventory methodology

fields.name: harvestsUpload-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Inventory documentation
fields.helper_text: Upload relevant documents regarding inventory development, analysis, and results

fields.name: inventoryAnalysis-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Inventory analysis and results
fields.tooltip: This may include number of plots, allocation of plots, measurements (DBH, tree heights, defects, status), etc.

fields.name: stratification-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Stratification is used
fields.tooltip: If the project activity area is not homogeneous, stratification may be used to improve the modeling of management scenarios and precision of carbon stock estimates

fields.name: noStratification-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Rationale for no stratification of the project area

fields.name: stratificationProcedure-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Stratification procedure and results
fields.tooltip: Should include sufficient information to reasonably ensure the validity and impartiality of the associated techniques. Stratification used to estimate initial stocking levels must be consistent across both the baseline and project scenarios.

fields.name: stratificationUpdates-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Stratification comments and updates
fields.tooltip: Required to provide comments if stratification has been updated. The stratification may be updated based on relevant changes to with-project scenario management, such as: unexpected disturbances during the crediting period (e.g., wildfire events) affecting different parts of an originally homogeneous stratum, management activities that affect the existing stratification, or merging of established strata.
fields.helper_text: If relevant, explain updates to the stratification procedure

fields.name: stratificationUpdatesDoc-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Stratification update documentation
fields.tooltip: Required to provide documentation if stratification has been updated

fields.name: growthYield-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Growth model overview
fields.tooltip: Describe the growth and yield model applied, including key details such as projection cycles, growth intervals or schedule, and the models start and end dates

fields.name: ertCalculation-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Baseline quantification overview
fields.tooltip: An outline of the GHG quantification approach used for the baseline scenario, covering all applicable emissions and removals along with calculation steps where relevant

fields.name: baselineHarvest-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Baseline harvest schedule scenario overview
fields.tooltip: The baseline harvesting strategy is defined as the one that yields the highest net present value (NPV) over a 100-year period, taking into account common practice

fields.name: baselineLegal-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Baseline legal constraints
fields.tooltip: Includes all legal constraints impacting baseline forest management, detailing each constraint and its effect on management, the geographic area it covers, the governing agency or body responsible, and how each constraint is accounted for in the baseline scenario
fields.helper_text: Include any and all legal constraints affecting baseline forest management including a description of each constraint and its effect

fields.name: baselineManagement-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Baseline management scenario
fields.tooltip: An explanation of the baseline management scenario throughout the crediting period, highlighting how it aligns or differs from common regional practices and applicable silvicultural guidelines. Also includes the rationale behind baseline assumptions, such as anticipated market demand for harvested products.

fields.name: previousOwnership-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Previous ownership class evidence
fields.tooltip: Evidence of previous ownership in a different category (e.g., non-federal public to private industrial) is required, as this will influence the discount rate used for NPV calculations. If using the discount rate of the previous ownership class, proof of the acquisition within 5 years of the project start date must be provided.

fields.name: sop-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Standard operating procedures (SOP) documentation
fields.tooltip: Minimum SOP documentation include stratification SOP, forest inventory SOP, and QA/QC SOP
fields.helper_text: Upload the SOP documentation

fields.name: silviculturalDocuments-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Baseline scenario supporting documentation
fields.tooltip: Additional documentation corresponding to the claims regarding the baseline scenario (e.g., publications, statements, or attestations from state or federal agencies; management records of the silvicultural prescriptions applied in similar forest conditions; or other verifiable evidence)

fields.name: bslSamplingOverviewTable-dataTable-dataTable
fields.label: Baseline sampling overview

columns.name: bslSamplingOverviewTableMethod
columns.label: Method
columns.tooltip: Sampling method, such as survey, direct measurement, etc.

columns.name: bslSamplingOverviewTablePurpose
columns.label: Purpose
columns.tooltip: For example, "baseline cookstove usage survey" for cookstoves

fields.tooltip: An overview of the different instances in which the sampling approach is employed to collect data on the parameters used to establish and quantify the baseline
fields.helper_text: Indicate the various instances of sampling undertaken to establish the baseline scenario and  quantification (e.g., if relevant, list the different surveys deployed in the baseline scenario, their purpose, the sample size, etc.)

fields.name: baselineComments-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Approach to carbon stocks forecasting
fields.tooltip: If applicable to the project, an overview of how baseline and/or project carbon stocks were forecasted into the future (e.g., which estimation method was used, any key assumptions, etc.)
fields.helper_text: If baseline and/or project carbon stocks are forecasted into the future, indicate the estimation method used (i.e., forest growth model) and describe any major assumptions applied

fields.name: baselineForecastWorkbook-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Baseline forecast documentation
fields.helper_text: Upload supporting documentation regarding the baseline (e.g., baseline carbon stock calculations, documents, etc.)

fields.name: projectActivityVerra-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Description of the project activity
fields.tooltip: An explanation of the project activity and how it will achieve GHG emission reductions or carbon dioxide removals, along with the implementation schedule for the activity or activities. The description should also cover any conservation, management, or planting efforts, and provide details on how various organizations, communities, and other entities are involved.

fields.name: projectHarvest-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project harvest schedule scenario overview
fields.tooltip: A summary of the intended harvest regime within the project scenario, detailing the types of harvest activities, their frequency, intensity, and other relevant parameters

field_groups.name: generalMethodDeviationsView
field_groups.label: General project documentation and method deviations

fields.name: deviations-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Methodology deviations
fields.tooltip: Includes information such as whether the deviation meets the criteria for permitted methodology deviations, whether the deviation negatively impacts the conservativeness of the quantification of emission reductions or removals (except where they result in increased accuracy), or any previously validated methodology deviations
fields.helper_text: Describe any methodology deviations applied and the steps taken to validate each deviation

fields.name: sensitiveInformation-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Commercially sensitive information
fields.tooltip: Explanation of why some proprietary information has been redacted or not included
fields.helper_text: Describe any information left undisclosed due to commercially sensitive status

fields.name: generalDocumentUploac-projectFile-storage
fields.label: General document upload
fields.tooltip: A general document upload field, in which any documents that are not explicitly asked for can be uploaded
fields.helper_text: Use this field to upload any outstanding documents related to the project

fields.name: ifmHarvestEvidence-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Harvest supporting documents
fields.helper_text: Upload documentation pertaining to the harvest events as part of the project activity

fields.name: disturbancesUpload-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Updated forestry inventory data post-disturbance documentation

field_groups.name: carbonCaptureInputs
field_groups.label: Carbon capture process inputs and outputs

fields.name: biomassEstimation-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Biomass estimation technique
options: Biomass algorithms based on regional volume equations from the USDA Forest Service National Volume Estimator Library
Species specific volume and biomass estimators according to geographic region
fields.tooltip: One of the biomass estimation techniques must be used and the same components must be calculated for ex ante and ex post baseline and with-project estimates

field_groups.name: projectStockEvidenceView
field_groups.label: Project carbon stock quantification supporting documents

fields.name: projectForecastWorkbook-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Project forecast documentation
fields.helper_text: Upload supporting documentation regarding the forecasted project carbon stocks (e.g., carbon stock calculations, documents, etc.)

fields.name: projectWorkbook-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Actual project carbon stock summary documentation
fields.helper_text: Upload documents related to the quantification of project carbon stocks

fields.name: ProjSamplingOverviewTable-dataTable-dataTable
fields.label: Project sampling overview
fields.tooltip: An overview of the different instances in which the sampling approach is employed to collect data on the parameters used to establish and quantify the project's impact
fields.helper_text: Indicate the various instances of sampling undertaken during the project's implementation and  quantification

fields.name: descriptionGeo-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Detailed description of the geographic boundary of project activities
fields.tooltip: A detailed description of the geographic boundaries of project activities, noting that the project may include multiple distinct land areas. Each area must have a unique geographical identifier and meet the eligibility requirements.

fields.name: uploadGeo-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Additional project boundary information
fields.tooltip: Information to delineate the project boundary may include: project area map, general location map, property parcel map or recognized equivalent, vicinity map with topography, HUC with drainage map, canopy cover map, land cover map, wildfire risk map, designated waterbodies map, etc.)
fields.helper_text: Upload relevant maps and geographic documents

fields.name: pestsACR-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project area forest pests and diseases

fields.name: priorConditionsACR-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Prior physical conditions
fields.tooltip: Description of the prior physical conditions of the project area, which can include information on the climactic zone, ecosystem, and vegetation

field_groups.name: fuelSourcingView
field_groups.label: Location(s) of fuel production or collection

fields.name: monitoringPlan-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: MRV protocol and monitoring plan overview
fields.tooltip: The monitoring plan may include: technical description of the monitoring tasks, data to be collected, overview of data collection procedures, quality control and quality assurance procedures, data archiving and organization and responsibilities of the parties involved
fields.helper_text: Describe the planned MRV protocol, including any monitoring plans

fields.name: dataProcess-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Data processing and storage procedures
fields.tooltip: Overview of the methods used to collect, clean, and securely store project monitoring data to ensure accuracy, traceability, and long-term accessibility

fields.name: mrvEnv-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Assessment of environmental risks, impacts, and monitoring plans
fields.helper_text: Describe each potential impact, it's risk category, and plans to monitor it

fields.name: monitoringWorkbook-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Monitoring supporting documents
fields.tooltip: Documents underpinning the monitoring approach (e.g., details on the parameters monitored, monitoring plan documentation etc.)

fields.name: dataParameters-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Additional comments on fixed and monitored parameters
fields.tooltip: Optional additional context regarding the fixed and monitored parameters used in project calculations
fields.helper_text: Optional space to include any additional details on the parameters used in project calculations

fields.name: mrvProtocol-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Actual MRV protocol is consistent with previously validated protocol

fields.name: mrvProtocolUpdates-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: If "No", detailed overview of updates to MRV protocol
fields.tooltip: Detail changes made to the previously validated MRV protocol described in tier 1

fields.name: mrvResultsDocs-projectFile-storage
fields.label: MRV results documentation
fields.tooltip: Documents may include monitoring reports, MRV workbooks, images, or other data types, etc.

fields.name: carbonStorageDetails-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Carbon storage overview
fields.tooltip: Details on how the carbon is stored and the estimated duration for which it remains stored in a safe and stable manner
fields.helper_text: Describe the project's carbon permanence, including references to external sources

fields.name: permanenceNumber-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Permanence
fields.tooltip: The projected duration (in years) over which removed carbon will be stored or prevented from entering the atmosphere, accounting for risks of reversal over time

fields.name: storageType-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Storage type
fields.tooltip: Carbon storage type refers to the form and location in which removed carbon is stored, categorized by the IPCC as terrestrial/biological (e.g., biomass, soil), geological (e.g., rock formations), marine/oceanic, or product-based (e.g., durable materials), each with varying levels of stability and permanence

fields.name: removalProcess-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Carbon removal process
fields.tooltip: Carbon removal process refers to the specific mechanism by which a carbon dioxide removal (CDR) method sequesters CO from the atmosphere, categorized according to the IPCC AR6 framework based on its role in the carbon cycle (e.g., biological, geochemical, ocean-based, or chemical pathways)

fields.name: reversalRiskOther-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project risk assessment
fields.tooltip: Optional additional context on the assessment of potential project risks (i.e., risks to carbon durability, risks to project viability, and/or risks to credit delivery)
fields.helper_text: Use this space to outline the potential reversal risks

fields.name: riskSummaryUpload-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Risk assessment documentation
fields.tooltip: Any documentation supporting the risk assessment
fields.helper_text: Upload any documentation supporting the risk assessment

fields.name: riskManagementPlan-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Risk management plan in place
fields.tooltip: A risk management plan encompasses a strategy for managing and mitigating risks that could impact a carbon project's ability to generate valid credits
fields.helper_text: Indicate "Yes" if there is a risk management plan in place

fields.name: riskPlan-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Risk management plan
fields.tooltip: Overview of the project's plan to mitigate risk (i.e., a systematic overview of the measures taken to mitigate and/or monitor reversal and project risks)
fields.helper_text: Outline the strategies undertaken to mitigate the aforementioned risks

fields.name: riskManagementPlanUpload-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Risk management plan supporting documents
fields.helper_text: Upload documentation of the risk management plan

fields.name: reversalRiskMitigationStrategy-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Reversal risk mitigation strategy
fields.tooltip: The strategy to address the potential loss of sequestered carbon by using financial tools or reserves, such as insurance or buffer pools, to compensate for potential reversals and ensure long-term credit validity

fields.name: otherReversalRiskMitigationStrategy-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Other reversal risk mitigation strategy type

fields.name: insuranceEvidence-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Insurance supporting evidence
fields.helper_text: Upload documentation supporting insurance claims

fields.name: compensation-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Risk mitigation mechanism(s) have been implemented

fields.name: compensationMechanismDescription-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Description of risk mitigation mechanism(s) in place

fields.name: compensationDetails-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Evidence of implementation of risk mitigation mechanism(s)
fields.helper_text: Provide evidence of the risk mitigation mechanism implemented by the responsible party

fields.name: reversalEvent-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Reversal event(s) has occured
fields.tooltip: Reversal events can include fire, pest and disease, extreme weather (e.g., drought, hurricane), geological risk (e.g., earthquakes, volcanoes), sea-level rise, and other events

fields.name: reversalEventType-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Type of reversal event(s)
fields.helper_text: Select the type(s) of reversal event(s) that have occured

fields.name: reversal-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Reversals reported and compensated following ACR requirements
fields.tooltip: Reversals reported and compensated following requirements detailed in the ACR AFOLU Carbon Project Reversal Risk Mitigation Agreement and the ACR Buffer Pool Terms and Conditions

fields.name: reversalEventStatusLink-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Evidence of status of reversal event(s)

fields.name: leakageDataGrid-dataGrid-dataGrid
fields.label: Leakage values
fields.tooltip: Leakage values calculated per vintage in tCO2e

fields.name: leakageTableUpdate-dataGrid-dataGrid
fields.label: Leakage values
fields.helper_text: Input the leakage values into the data grid

fields.name: leakageMonitor-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project exhibits activity-shifting leakage above the de minimis threshold
fields.tooltip: The de minimis threshold is set at 3% of the final calculation of emission reductions and removals

fields.name: activityLeakageAdditional-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Activity-shifting leakage quantification approach
fields.helper_text: Describe the approach taken to calculate the activity-shifting leakage, including all relevant assumptions

fields.name: marketLeakageUpload-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Market leakage documentation
fields.helper_text: Upload supporting documentation related to market leakage

fields.name: leakageDemo-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Demonstration of no significant activity-shifting leakage
fields.tooltip: Demonstration must include one or more of the following: organization-wide compliance with sustainable management practices; forest management plans created at least 24 months before the project showing consistent harvest levels across all lands; historical harvest data showing no significant deviation from 10-year trends; or verifiable proof of no harvesting during the reporting period on all non-project lands owned or managed by participating entities

fields.name: additionalActualUncertainty-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Overview of uncertainty calculation
fields.helper_text: Describe how uncertainty is accounted for in the project activity

fields.name: bufferActualsConditional-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project maintains a carbon credit buffer pool

fields.name: nonPermanenceTool-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project uses an approved risk tool to allocate buffer credits

fields.name: additionalCommentsBuffer-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Overview of buffer determination
fields.helper_text: Provide an overview of how buffer is accounted for in the project activity

fields.name: additionalityApproachUsed-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Additionality approaches used in the project
fields.tooltip: Evaluating additionality ensures that carbon credits are granted only to mitigation activities that would not have occurred without the incentives provided by the carbon credit
fields.helper_text: Select which approaches are utilized by the project to demonstrate additionality

fields.name: validationAdditionality-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: The selected additionality approaches have been validated
fields.tooltip: All elements of the chosen additionality approaches have been assessed by a validation or verification body and/or a carbon-crediting program or standard
fields.helper_text: Confirm validation by a VVB and/or the carbon-crediting program

fields.name: recentUpdate-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Latest review
fields.tooltip: The most recent year that the assessment for the standardized approach was reviewed
fields.helper_text: Indicate the most recent review year

fields.name: priorConsiderationOfCredits-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Carbon credits considered prior to the start date of the project
fields.tooltip: An additionality test that assesses whether carbon revenue was considered or planned for before a projects implementation. Evidence of such "prior consideration" helps demonstrate that the project would not have been developed without the financial incentive from carbon credits.

fields.name: priorConsiderationDetails-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Details of prior consideration of carbon credits

fields.name: priorConsideration-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Evidence of prior consideration of carbon credits

fields.name: firstOfItsKind-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project mitigation activity is the first-of-its-kind
fields.tooltip: First-of-its-kind projects implement innovative approaches or technologies that set them apart from any existing practices or solutions within a given sector or region

fields.name: firstOfItsKindAnalysis-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: First-of-its-kind mitigation activity details and justification
fields.helper_text: Describe the mitigation activity, including the sector and/or region in which the activity qualifies as 'first-of-its-kind'

fields.name: regulatorySurplus-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: The project is not required by and/or exceeds existing applicable laws, regulations, or other binding obligations
fields.tooltip: Regulatory additionality ensures that a carbon credit can only be issued for a mitigation activity that goes beyond what is required by existing laws or regulations

fields.name: regulatorySurplusTestDetails-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Relevant laws, regulations, and/or binding obligations justifying the regulatory surplus test
fields.tooltip: Overview of applicable laws and regulations used to justify regulatory additionality by demonstrating that the mitigation activity is not legally required
fields.helper_text: Indicate the relevant laws or regulations that support the justification of regulatory additionality (i.e., do not require the mitigation activity)

fields.name: regulatorySurplusUpload-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Supporting documentation demonstrating legal and regulatory additionality
fields.helper_text: Upload documentation demonstrating the project's legal and regulatory additionality

fields.name: commonPractice-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: The project demonstrates a low level of penetration or successfully passes the common practice test within a similar sector, region, or activity
fields.tooltip: The common practice or market penetration test evaluates whether a mitigation activity is widely adopted in a sector or region. If the activity is already standard practice, it is not considered additional and is therefore ineligible for carbon credits.

fields.name: threshold-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Threshold or maximum adoption level for market penetration

fields.name: commonPracticeDetails-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Common practice test details
fields.tooltip: Overview of the approach used to determine additionality and the methodology, carbon-crediting program, or equivalent entity responsible for determining the threshold for market penetration
fields.helper_text: Describe the approach used to determine additionality and indicate the methodology, carbon-crediting program, or equivalent entity responsible for determining the threshold for market penetration

fields.name: initialAdditionality-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project is a direct result of carbon credit finance
fields.tooltip: Project is not financially feasible or is less financially attractive without carbon credit revenues compared to the alternatives of the mitigation activity

fields.name: additionalityDemonstration-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Demonstration that the project activities are a result of carbon finance
fields.helper_text: Upload documentation supporting the economic additionality of the project

fields.name: investmentMethod-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Investment analysis approach
fields.tooltip: Indicates which assessment method is used for the financial investment analysis

fields.name: financialIndicator-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Chosen financial indicator
fields.tooltip: The suitable financial indicator, such as the net present value (NPV) or internal rate of return (IRR) used consistently throughout calculations
fields.helper_text: Indicate the financial indicator used consistently throughout the calculations

fields.name: simpleCostAdditionality-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project has no other income or minimal capital expenditures compared to operational expenditures

fields.name: simpleCostAnalysis-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Simple cost analysis details
fields.tooltip: Simple cost analysis is a financial additionality test that compares a project's expected costs and revenues to determine if it would be economically unattractive without carbon credit income. If the project does not generate sufficient returns or would operate at a loss without the added revenue from credits, it may be deemed additional.

fields.name: benchmarkUsed-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project uses a financial benchmark approach
fields.tooltip: The benchmark approach compares a project's expected return (e.g., IRR or NPV) to a predefined financial benchmark. If the project's return falls below this benchmark without carbon credit revenue, it may be considered financially additional.

fields.name: benchmarkJustification-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Justification and results of the financial benchmark analysis

fields.name: investmentComparisonDetails-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Justification and results of the investment comparison analysis
fields.tooltip: The investment comparison approach assesses whether the proposed project is less economically attractive than one or more alternative investment options. If the project would not be chosen over more financially viable alternatives without carbon credit revenue, it may be considered additional.

fields.name: sensitivityAnalysis-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project conducts a sensitivity analysis
fields.tooltip: A sensitivity analysis is required to show whether the conclusion regarding the financial attractiveness is robust to reasonable variation in the critical assumptions

fields.name: projectRevenues-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Breakdown of project revenue
fields.tooltip: Detailed breakdown of all revenue, including cost savings and public subsidies, related to the project

fields.name: costs-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Breakdown of project costs
fields.tooltip: Detailed breakdown of all project-related costs, including both operational expenditures and capital expenditures

fields.name: barrier-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: The project faces an implementation barrier for which carbon credit revenues are the decisive element in overcoming the barrier
fields.tooltip: Barrier analysis is an additionality test used to identify and assess the key obstacles (e.g., financial, technical, regulatory, or market-related) that would prevent a project from being implemented without carbon credit revenue

fields.name: barrierType-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Implementation barrier(s) the project faces
fields.tooltip: Indicates which type of barrier analysis is conducted. Examples of each include: financial barriers, institutional barriers, information barriers, other barriers specific to the project and/or region where the project is implemented if these barriers are explicitly identified and elaborated in the relevant quantification methodology or other program documents.

fields.name: barrierTypeOther-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Other barrier type(s)
fields.helper_text: Describe the barrier(s) used to demonstrate additionality

fields.name: fiancialBarrierDetails-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Explanation and results of chosen barrier(s)

fields.name: barrierDemo-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Demonstration of barriers
fields.tooltip: Evidence to (i) demonstrate each identified barrier and (ii) show that carbon credit revenues are the key factor in overcoming each barrier
fields.helper_text: Upload evidence of (i) each identified barrier and (ii) economic additionality

fields.name: barrierAlternative-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Alternative scenario barrier details
fields.tooltip: Demonstration that at least one other alternative to the project does not face significant barriers, including the barriers faced by the project

fields.name: barrierAlternativeUpload-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Supporting documentation for alternative scenario barrier(s)

fields.name: performanceAdditionality-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project activity exceeds a relevant emission reductions and/or removals benchmark
fields.tooltip: Performance-based additionality is an approach where a projects carbon credit eligibility is tied to its actual performance in achieving emission reductions or removals

fields.name: performanceAdditionalityDetails-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Details and results of performance-based additionality approach

fields.name: performanceAdditionalityUpload-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Evidence and documentation of performance-based additionality

fields.name: alternativeScenarios-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Counterfactuals or alternative scenarios
fields.tooltip: The counterfactuals, or alternative scenarios, that could happen if the mitigation activity did not occur
fields.helper_text: List the counterfactuals, or alternative scenarios, that could happen if the mitigation activity did not occur

fields.name: counterfactualAnalysis-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Counterfactual or alternative scenario details and results
fields.tooltip: A summary of the counterfactual scenario outlining what would likely have occurred in the absence of carbon finance, where CO2 removals are considered additional only when measured against a conservative baseline representing this alternative scenario
fields.helper_text: Describe the counter-factual scenario for what would likely have happened without carbon finance

fields.name: counterfactualEvidence-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Counterfactual or alternative scenario documentation
fields.tooltip: Counter-factual analysis based on baselines that are project-specific, conservative and periodically updated
fields.helper_text: Upload supporting documentation underpinning the counter-factual analysis

fields.name: standardizedApproach-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: The project uses another standardized approach to demonstrate additionality

fields.name: additionalAdditionality-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Name of other standardized additionality approach

fields.name: additionalAdditionalityDeatils-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Details and results of the standardized additionality approach

fields.name: activitiesApplicable-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Applicable activities and / or technologies
fields.tooltip: The standardized approach must be defined at an appropriate level of aggregation of technologies/activities and at a high level of stringency

fields.name: additionalAdditionalityEvidence-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Supporting evidence for other additionality measures

fields.name: projectCostAssumptions-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Cost assumptions
fields.tooltip: Key fixed and variable cost categories included in the baseline and project NPV calculations, such as taxes, property boundary maintenance, administrative staff, road maintenance, and timber marking are all fixed costs and vary based on the area, silvicultural, logging, and harvesting costs etc.

fields.name: projectRevenueAssumptions-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Revenue assumptions
fields.tooltip: Key revenue categories included, such as from harvested wood products

fields.name: npvResults-dataGrid-dataGrid
fields.label: NPV cash flows

options.name: baselineNPV
options.label: Discounted cash flow in the baseline scenario (USD)

options.name: projectNPV
options.label: Discounted cash flow in the project scenario (USD)

fields.tooltip: 100 year NPV calculation outputs for the baseline and project scenarios

fields.name: npvCalculationOverview-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: NPV calculation overview and assumptions
fields.tooltip: Summary of NPV process and calculations, including any additional assumptions made

fields.name: npvWorkbook-projectFile-storage
fields.label: NPV supporting documents
fields.tooltip: Documentation related to the NPV calculation, including NPV calculation workbooks
fields.helper_text: Provide all documentation related to the NPV calculation, including workbooks or model output summaries. If not available, then fill out the template related to NPV.

fields.name: projectValidation-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project has been validated by a third-party

fields.name: validationDate-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Last validation date
fields.helper_text: Enter date of last validation or indicate 'under validation' (if applicable)

fields.name: validationUpload-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Validation documentation
fields.helper_text: Provide project validation documents if these are available

fields.name: validationBody-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Validation body
fields.helper_text: Enter name of validation body

fields.name: validationBodySelectionOther-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Other method of selecting validation body

fields.name: validationBodySectoralScopes-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Accredited sectoral scopes of the validation body
options: 11. Fugitive emissions  from Industrial gases (halocarbons and sulphur hexafluoride)
14. Agriculture, Forestry and Other Land Use (AFOLU)

fields.name: validationBodyAccreditationOther-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Other validation body accreditation or membership

fields.name: verification-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Emission reductions and / or removals have been verified by a third-party

fields.name: verificationSame-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Verification body is the same as the validation body

fields.name: verificationBodySelectionOther-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Other method of selecting verification body

fields.name: verificationResampling-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Verification field visit overview
fields.tooltip: Description of the activities conducted during the verification site visit (e.g., resampling of the carbon stock measurements)

fields.name: verificationUpload-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Verification documentation
fields.helper_text: Upload documentation evidencing the verification has occured

fields.name: verificationBodyAccreditationOther-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Other verification body accreditation or membership

fields.name: verificationBodySectoralScopes-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Accredited sectoral scopes of the verification body
options: 11. Fugitive emissions  from Industrial gases (halocarbons and sulphur hexafluoride)
14. Agriculture, Forestry and Other Land Use (AFOLU)

fields.name: sdgUpload-projectFile-storage
fields.label: SDG documentation
fields.helper_text: Upload relevant SDG documentation (e.g., registry-specific templates etc.)

fields.name: sdgVerification-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: SDG claims have been third party verified

fields.name: economicDisplacementExplain-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Expected economic displacement effects
fields.helper_text: Describe any potential economic displacement effects. If none, provide a brief explanation justifying the absence of such impacts.

fields.name: economicDisplacementPlan-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Mitigation plan in place to address economic displacement effects

fields.name: economicDisplacementDetails-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Overview of activities included in the mitigation plan
fields.helper_text: Describe what type of activity the mitigation plan entails (including but not limited to avoidance, minimization, mitigation, and/or compensation)

fields.name: economicDisplacementPlanEvidence-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Documentation of mitigation plan for economic displacement

fields.name: physicalDisplacementExplain-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Expected physical displacement effects
fields.helper_text: Indicate any potential impacts or risks of the project activity on local physical displacement

fields.name: physicalMitigation-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Mitigation plan in place to address physical displacement effects

fields.name: physicalMitigationDetails-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Details of mitigation plan to address physical displacement
fields.tooltip: Mitigation may include, but is not limited to, avoidance, minimization, mitigation, and/or compensation activities

fields.name: physicalUpload-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Documentation of mitigation plan for physical displacement

fields.name: communityDescription-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Communities and other stakeholders impacted or potentially impacted by the project
fields.helper_text: Outline the communities and other stakeholders impacted (or potentially impacted) by project activities

fields.name: stakeholderIdentificationProcess-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Stakeholder identification process
fields.tooltip: Overview of the method utilized to identify stakeholders that may be affected by project activities
fields.helper_text: Outline the process used to identify stakeholders impacted or potentially impacted by project activities

fields.name: communityImpactDetails-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Details on expected impacts to communities and stakeholders
fields.tooltip: Overview of the potential impacts the project could incur on the various identified stakeholders
fields.helper_text: Describe the existing or expected impacts to the identified stakeholders and communities

fields.name: stakeholderConsultationActual-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project has developed a stakeholder consultation plan

fields.name: consultationDetails-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Overview of stakeholder consultation plan
fields.tooltip: Plan description can include frequency of meetings, format types (e.g. 1-1 interview, roundtable discussions, focus groups), and how these discussions will be recorded and addressed
fields.helper_text: Describe the stakeholder consultation process plan (e.g., format, consultation protocol, etc.)

fields.name: communityConsultationNegativeDetails-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Justification for the absence of a stakeholder consultation plan
fields.helper_text: Justify why the project has not developed a stakeholder engagement and consultation plan

fields.name: consultationDocuments-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Stakeholder consultation plan supporting documents
fields.tooltip: Documents could include a community consultation process overview, consultation timeline, registry-specific documents or questionnaires, etc.

fields.name: deiGroup-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Groups expected to be the focus of outreach and consultations

fields.name: deiConsult-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project plans to consult and engage with specific vulnerable social groups
fields.tooltip: Indicates whether the project is expected to consult specific groups, such as women, people with disabilities, and/or other minority groups (among others) who may be disproportionately affected by the project compared to other groups

fields.name: deiIConsultDetails-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Overview of consultation/engagement plans with identified social groups
fields.helper_text: Describe any engagement plans or processes with the identified specific vulnerable communities

fields.name: deiPositiveImpacts-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Expected positive impacts of the project activity on the identified social groups

fields.name: deiRiskDetails-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Potential risks to the identified social groups
fields.tooltip: Description of any possible risks and/or negative impacts the project may have on the identified social groups
fields.helper_text: Indicate any potential risks or possible negative impacts the project may have on the identified social groups

fields.name: exploitation-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project addresses harrassment or exploitation of women within the household or other project areas
fields.tooltip: Indication of whether the project addresses exploitation, harassment of women and/or minority groups in the community

fields.name: deiGenderConsultations-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project plans to conduct gender sensitive consultations
fields.tooltip: Examples include data collection methods comprised of women-only respondents

fields.name: womenRights-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Women are formally and fairly entitled to project-related resources
fields.tooltip: For example, if women are formally and fairly entitled to project-related land, water, or other types of resources

fields.name: deiMonitoringPlan-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Description of gender action plan and resources utilized
fields.tooltip: Overview of the project's approach to monitoring and/or addressing gendered impacts (e.g., safeguarding against negative impacts or enabling positive impacts)
fields.helper_text: Outline the plan to monitor and address gender-specific elements as part of the project activity, and describe any tools or resources used to develop the plan

fields.name: communityExists-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project activities take place in close proximity to tribal or Indigenous lands or otherwise affect Indigenous peoples

fields.name: communityConsultation-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Indigenous people and/or local communities, including minority groups within, have been informed and agreed to project activities

fields.name: landRightsRec-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project contains explicit contracts with Indigenous, tribal, and local communities before the project begins

fields.name: carbonContractLength-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Length of project contract with Indigenous, tribal, and local communities

fields.name: contractPublic-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Publicly available information on the contracts with communities or governments
fields.helper_text: Describe any information about the nature of the contracts between the Indigenous, tribal, or local communities and the project developer/owner

fields.name: contractPenalty-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Penalty clauses on the contracts for Indigenous, tribal, and local communities
fields.helper_text: Describe any penalty clauses that exist within the contracts between Indigenous, tribal, or local communities and the project developer/owner

fields.name: specialMeasureDetails-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Data integration into free, prior, and informed consent
fields.tooltip: Details on how data was integrated into free, prior, and informed consent
fields.helper_text: Describe methods taken to integrate data collected into principles of free, prior, and informed consent

fields.name: grievance-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project will establish a grievance mechanism to enable stakeholders to report and address concerns

fields.name: grievanceReport-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Grievances and other reported issues are made public

fields.name: grievanceDate-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Date by which grievance mechanism was/will be open to communities

fields.name: grievanceDetails-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Overview of the grievance mechanism available for stakeholders

fields.name: grievanceSupport-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Grievance mechanism supporting documents
fields.tooltip: Uploads may include details on the grievance mechanism's structure, reported issues addressed, and availability date

fields.name: benefitSharing-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project will implement a benefit sharing model
fields.tooltip: Benefit sharing with the local community (e.g. subsidization of products, revenue sharing etc.)

fields.name: benefitSharingExplanation-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Benefit sharing model explanation
fields.tooltip: If relevant, explanation of how benefits related to the carbon credit project are established and assigned to different stakeholders

fields.name: benefitSharingNoExplanation-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Rationale for no benefit sharing
fields.tooltip: If relevant, explanation of how benefits related to the carbon credit project are established and assigned to different stakeholders

fields.name: benefitUpload-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Benefit sharing agreement supporting documentation
fields.helper_text: Upload supporting evidence of the benefit sharing agreement

fields.name: benefitSharingCommunities-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Benefit sharing agreement in place with Indigenous communities

fields.name: compensationType-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Benefit sharing type offered to Indigenous, tribal, and/or local communtities
options: In-kind benefits or public goods - Local infrastructure improvements
In-kind benefits or public goods - Local employment

fields.name: compensationPercent-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Projected % sale price going to Indigenous, tribal, and local communities

fields.name: iplcOwnershipPercent-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Current or projected % of company owned by Indigenous, tribal, and local communities

fields.name: stakeholderEngagementImpact-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project demonstrates ongoing engagement with identified stakeholder throughout the project lifetime

fields.name: stakeholderEngagementDetails-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Overview of the project's engagement with stakeholders
fields.tooltip: Details include items like processes implemented for ongoing communication, format, and frequency of engagements, etc.

fields.name: stakeholderEngagementUpload-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Stakeholder engagement plan supporting documents
fields.helper_text: Upload supporting documentation detailing the project's stakeholder engagement plan

fields.name: genderHarassmentMeasures-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Measures taken to lessen harrassment or exploitation of women within the household and/or other project areas

fields.name: womenConsultation-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project consults women separately on their perspectives and concerns

fields.name: genderConsultation-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Gendered concerns and issues surfaced and discussed through consultation
fields.helper_text: Summarize the approach taken to specifically consult and address issues surfaced by women affected by the project activity

fields.name: genderPowerPositions-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Percentage of women that hold decision making powers or leadership roles within the project

fields.name: deiWomen-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Women are central to the project's success

fields.name: genderDataDetails-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Overview of approaches for collecting gender impact data

fields.name: dataInfringementIndigenous-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Data collection or monitoring does not infringe on privacy rights of Indigenous peoples and local communities

fields.name: dataInfringementIndigenousDetails-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Details on measures taken to protect the privacy of Indigenous peoples and local communities

fields.name: resettlementOutcome-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project activities have resulted in involuntary displacement
fields.tooltip: This includes both economic displacement, which encompasses the loss of land, access to assets, income sources, or means of livelihoods, and physical displacement, encompassing the result of eviction, acquisition, rehabilitation, or demolition of property, or the expiration of covenants housing. These activities can be due to involuntary acquisition / restrictions on land use or limiting access to legally designated parks and protected areas.

sections.name: economicImpactsView
sections.label: Economic, fiscal, and benefit sharing impacts

fields.name: revenueShare-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Monetary benefit-sharing incorporates profit or revenue distribution
fields.tooltip: Differentiates whether communities recieve a percentage of profits or revenues of the project per benefit sharing agreements

fields.name: payementsMade-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Benefit sharing financial payments made to date

fields.name: smartContracts-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Transaction is enabled by smart contracts

fields.name: fairTradePricing-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project engages in fairtrade pricing
fields.helper_text: Please refer to FCC price methodology for more information https://files.fairtrade.net/standards/FCC_price_methodology.pdf

fields.name: deiBenefitSharing-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Financial benefit sharing impact on women, Indigenous, Tribal and/or other minority groups
fields.tooltip: Details on how much money is reaching vulnerable groups, which groups/communities the payments are reaching, and how money is being used (if information is available)
fields.helper_text: If relevant, describe how much money is reaching women and vulnerable communities in the project context, including how money is being used. If the benefit sharing model does not specifically reach women or other  vulnerable groups, indicate that here.

fields.name: paymentsFrequencyIndigenous-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Frequency of payments to Indigenous, tribal, and/or local communities

fields.name: deiBenefitSharingUpload-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Financial benefit sharing documentation
fields.helper_text: Upload supporting documentation detailing the project's benefit sharing model and/or evidence of its implementation

fields.name: airMonitoringPlan-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project has or will implement an air pollution monitoring plan

fields.name: airMonitoringDomains-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Domains included in the air pollution monitoring plan

fields.name: airMonitoringDescription-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Description of air pollution monitoring plan

fields.name: airMonitoringBaseline-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Pollutants monitored in baseline air quality
fields.tooltip: Air monitoring can include continuous measurement of criteria air pollutants or tracking of the air quality index in a target region, for example
fields.helper_text: Indicate the pollutants monitored in the baseline air quality

fields.name: airBaselineEvidence-projectFile-storage
fields.label: Baseline air quality documentation
fields.helper_text: Upload documents related to baseline air pollution, including air quality calculations. For baseline indoor air pollution levels, sources may include reports of field or lab testing of the technology, results of modelling of the technologys operation under field conditions, expert opinion etc.

fields.name: waterLocalDetails-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Summary of expected water impacts of the project activity
fields.helper_text: Outline the potential impacts of the project activity on the identified water resources

fields.name: waterImpact-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project activity takes place near a water basin

fields.name: waterMonitoringPlan-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project plans to monitor water resources

fields.name: waterMonitoringFrequency-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Monitoring frequency of water resources
fields.tooltip: Details on how frequently the project developer will monitor water resources affected by the project activity

fields.name: waterMonitorIntention-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Description of water resources monitoring plan

fields.name: waterStewardship-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Water-related activity classification within the project activity
options: Land conservation and restoration - Land conservation (protection and preservation)
Land conservation and restoration - Land cover restoration
Water supply reliability - Agricultural water demand reduction measures
Water supply reliability - Operational efficiency measures
Water supply reliability - Consumer use efficiency measures
Water supply reliability - New water supply for water irrigation
Water access - Access to drinking water supply
Water Quality - Agricultural best management practices
Water Quality - Constructed wetland treatment systems
Aquatic habitat restoration - Wetland restoration and creation
Aquatic habitat restoration - Legal transactions to keep water in-stream
Aquatic habitat restoration - In-stream barrier removal
Aquatic habitat restoration - Floodplain inundation/reestablish hydrologic connection
Water Governance - direct engagement in water governance and pulic water management
Catalytic activities - Activities that pave the way for longer-term water stewardship outcomes

fields.name: expectedWaterImpacts-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Expected water impacts as a result of the project activity
options: Project affects local ground water recharge rates

fields.name: waterBaselineDescription-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Description of baseline water resources
fields.helper_text: Depending on the scope of the project activity and baseline monitoring, describe the baseline water resources (i.e., in terms of quality, availability etc)

fields.name: biodiversityImpactDrivers-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Summary of expected biodiversity impacts of the project activity
fields.tooltip: Description of expected biodiversity and other ecosystem impacts of the project and their drivers. Impacts can include both positive and negative impacts. Indicate if none.
fields.helper_text: Indicate any potential positive impacts or potential risks imposed by project activities

fields.name: ecosystemBiome-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Biome type
fields.tooltip: Type of biome in which the project operates

fields.name: ecosystemCategorization-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Ecosystem categorization
fields.tooltip: As per the IUCN, ecosystem risk refers to an ecosystem's vulnerability of collapse, determined by reductions in geographical distribution or degradation of the components of ecosystems and the services they provide (more information can be found here: https://assessments.iucnrle.org/)

fields.name: biomeDescription-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Description of the biome
fields.helper_text: Description should be in accordance with the IUCN Global Ecosystem Typology Version 2.0

fields.name: biomeRiskCategory-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Description of the biome risk category
fields.helper_text: Description should be in accordance with the IUCN Global Ecosystem Typology Version 2.0

fields.name: biodiversityMonitoring-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project plans to identify and monitor related biodiversity impacts before, during, and after project implementation

fields.name: biodiversityMonitoringProcess-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Biodiversity monitoring plan
fields.tooltip: The process of identifying and monitoring relevant biodiversity indicators (e.g., fauna, flora, and non-timber forest products) before and after project intervention
fields.helper_text: If relevant, describe any plans to identify and monitor biodiversity impacts

fields.name: baselineBiodiversity-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project has conducted an initial biodiversity survey

fields.name: threatenedSpecies-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: International Union for Conservation (IUCN) threatened and endangered species
fields.tooltip: Overview of the threatened and endangered species in the surrounding geographic region or otherwise potentially affected by project activities
fields.helper_text: List relevant threatened and endangered species and the potential impacts incurred by project activities

fields.name: biodiversityLegal-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Legal framework governing the threatened and endangered species

fields.name: soilEffects-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Summary of expected soil impacts of the project activity
fields.tooltip: Description of expected soil impacts (e.g., physical, chemical, and biological soil ecosystem impacts). If relevant and known, the assessment should reference soil temperature, type, and chemistry)

fields.label: Project follows an air pollution monitoring plan which considers the following

fields.label: Pollutant monitoring mechanisms

fields.helper_text: Describe the approach used by the project to monitor air pollution including the use of passive devices and air quality monitors in select locations

fields.label: Ambient and/or indoor air impacts claimed are third-party verified

fields.label: Species diversity data is digital and can be audited

options: Water filtration before re-introduction to water table
Use of settling ponds to clean water before re-entry to water table

fields.name: waterVWBConditional-nameValue-nameValue
fields.label: Project uses Volumetric Water Benefit (VWB) indicators
fields.tooltip: The Volumetric Water Benefit Accounting, published by WRI, is a common tool used to calculate and communicate volumetric water benefits of activities that contribute to meeting water stewardship outcomes, SDG targets, and help solve shared water challenges
